Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.jeopardy.service.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
Central controller responsible for managing all gameplay operations in the Jeopardy application. This class coordinates:
  • Game state management (players, turn order, status)
  • Loading and accessing questions and categories
  • Answer evaluation and scoring
  • Event creation and logging through GameEventLogger
  • Summary report generation
It serves as the primary API used by the UI layer and the integration tests.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameController()
    Constructs a new GameController: Initializes a fresh GameState Generates a unique case ID based on the clock Creates a CSV event logger tied to this case

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController()
      Constructs a new GameController:
      • Initializes a fresh GameState
      • Generates a unique case ID based on the clock
      • Creates a CSV event logger tied to this case

  • Method Details

    • getGameplayEvents

      public List<GameEvent> getGameplayEvents()
      Returns:
      list of recorded gameplay events

    • getCaseId

      public String getCaseId()
      Returns:
      the session's unique Case ID

    • getGameState

      public GameState getGameState()
      Returns:
      the current GameState backing the controller

    • getPlayers

      public List<Player> getPlayers()
      Returns:
      list of all players in the game

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Returns:
      the player whose turn it currently is

    • getCategories

      public List<Category> getCategories()
      Returns:
      list of loaded categories or empty list if none loaded

    • getGame

      public Object getGame()
      Returns:
      reference to this controller (used in report generator)

    • getQuestion

      public Question getQuestion(String categoryName, int value)
      Retrieves a question matching the given category and point value.
      Parameters:
      categoryName - the category label
      value - the question's point value
      Returns:
      the matching Question, or null if not found

    • systemEvent

      public void systemEvent(String activity, String category, Integer value, String extra)
      Logs a system-level or UI-driven event (e.g., selecting categories, choosing players, loading files). The formatting rules implemented here are designed to match the required CSV event log specification.
      Parameters:
      activity - description of the event (e.g., "Start Game")
      category - optional category affected by event
      value - optional question value
      extra - optional supplemental detail (e.g., chosen name or count)

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame(List<String> names, GameData gameData)
      Initializes a new game session by:
      • Storing the provided GameData
      • Setting status to IN_PROGRESS
      • Creating a Player object for each given name
      Parameters:
      names - list of player display names
      gameData - structured category/question data

    • forceEndGame

      public void forceEndGame()
      Forces the game to end immediately by setting status to FINISHED.

    • checkAndEndGame

      public boolean checkAndEndGame()
      Checks whether all questions across all categories have been answered. If so, the game is marked as finished.
      Returns:
      true if all questions are answered

    • isGameFinished

      public boolean isGameFinished()
      Returns:
      true if the game state is FINISHED

    • answerQuestion

      public boolean answerQuestion(String categoryName, int value, String answer)
      Processes a player's attempt to answer a question.

      Performs:

      • Correct/incorrect scoring
      • Marking the question as answered
      • Logging an "Answer Question" event
      • Storing the event for report building
      Parameters:
      categoryName - category containing the question
      value - point value of question
      answer - player's chosen answer (A/B/C/D)
      Returns:
      true if the answer is correct

    • generateSummaryReport

      public Path generateSummaryReport() throws IOException
      Generates a text-based summary report using the configured SummaryReportGenerator.
      Returns:
      path to the resulting report file
      Throws:
      IOException - if writing the report fails

    • getWinners

      public List<Player> getWinners()
      Returns:
      list of all players tied for highest score

    • isTie

      public boolean isTie()
      Returns:
      true if two or more players share the top score

    • getGameResult

      public String getGameResult()
      Returns:
      textual summary of winning state or tie

    • getWinner

      public Player getWinner()
      Returns:
      the highest-scoring player, or null if none

    • nextPlayer

      public void nextPlayer()
      Advances to the next player's turn.
